name: ethyl 5-amino-3-(methylsulfanyl)-1-[(3-nitrophenyl)carbonyl]-1H-pyrazole-4-carboxylate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1995
Reason: The presence of the pyrazole ring contributes to the melting point due to its planarity and rigidity, estimated to increase the melting point by +20 to +30°C. The amino group contributes to the melting point due to its polarity and hydrogen bonding capability, estimated to increase the melting point by +20 to +30°C. The methylsulfanyl group contributes to the melting point due to its polarity and sulfur's high melting point, estimated to increase the melting point by +20 to +30°C. The nitro group contributes to the melting point due to its polarity and electron-withdrawing ability, estimated to increase the melting point by +10 to +20°C. The carbonyl group contributes to the melting point due to its polarity and increased molecular weight, estimated to increase the melting point by +10 to +20°C. The presence of multiple functional groups can also contribute to synergistic effects, potentially increasing the melting point by +10 to +20°C.
